required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability of Hammersmith Examination in Prediction of Neurological Outcomes (REHAPENO)
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability of Hammersmith Examination in Prediction of Neurological Outcomes In Preterm Infants - Observational Study (REHAPENO)

brief_summary.textblock: In this study workers are trying to test the correlation between Hammersmith Infant Neurological Examination and MRI brain/cranial ultrasound with early prediction of neurological developmental outcome of preterm neonates. This study is prospective cross-sectional collecting the data of patients according to daily standard medical practice

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary aim of this study is to evaluate the neurobehavioural performance of infants born preterm using the Hammersmith Infant Neurological Examination (HINE) in standard medical practice and compare it with the gold standard MRI and ultrasound imagings. It would be possible to check do we need to use all the 3 examinations or Hammersmith examination would be enough reliable predictor. Secondary aim is to explore the relationships between MRI brain /cranial us abnormalities and HINE at term-equivalent age in infants born preterm in prediction of neurological outcome at 1 year of chronological age.
This study will be only single arm/single group. This group would receive the regular practice of MRI, Ultrasound (US) and Hammersmith assessments. The 3 assessments would be compared in relationships with the neonatal developmental outcomes (developmental milestones).

primary_outcome.measure: Non inferiority of MRI to Hammersmith assessments in developmental outcomes
primary_outcome.description: Hammersmith assessment will be tested for non-inferiority to gold standard assessment method by MRI in terms of sensitivity for early prediction of delayed neurological syndrome (DNS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Superiority testing for Hammersmith assessment to gold standard MRI
secondary_outcome.description: Testing the superiority of Hammersmith assessment versus gold standard MRI in terms sensitivity for early prediction of DNS

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparing the correlations of MRI and US scans with early prediction of DNS
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing the correlations of MRI and US scans with the early prediction of DNS

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparing the correlations of US scan and Hammersmith assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing the correlations of US scan and Hammersmith assessment with the early prediction of DNS

secondary_outcome.measure: Hammersmith health economic analyses if primary endpoint is achieved
secondary_outcome.description: Both cost minimization analyses and cost effective analyses would be applied

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity and sensitivity for all techniques MRI, US and Hammersmith
secondary_outcome.description: Calculations for specificity and sensitivity would be applied for MRI, US and Hammersmith

arm_group.description: Preterm infants <37 weeks' gestational age (GA) at birth admitted to the neonatal nurseries at the Abha Private Hospital in Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. This project aims to recruit 50 infants <37weeks at birth over a 1-year stating from march 2018. A Correlation analyses for the outcomes with initial regular medical practice of MRI/Ultrasound and Hammersmith assessment.

intervention.description: No medical intervention would be done. The single arm would receive regular practice of Hammersmith Assessment and MRI / Ultrasound

study_pop.textblock: Preterm infants <37 weeks' GA at birth admitted to the neonatal nurseries at the Abha Private Hospital in Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. This project aims to recruit 50 infants <37weeks at birth over a 1-year stating from march 2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preterm infants <37 weeks' GA at birth admitted to the neonatal nurseries at the Abha Private Hospital in Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. This project aims to recruit 50 infants <37weeks at birth over a 1-year stating from march 2018
Exclusion Criteria:
- -infants with congenital or chromosomal abnormalities

overall_official.affiliation: College of Medicine, Al Azhar University
